context: In <a0_0><b5_0>December<b5_0/> <b6_0>2011<b6_0/><a0_0/>, the system went into operation on a trial basis. It has started providing navigation, positioning and timing data to China and the neighbouring area for free from <a1_0>27 <b7_0>December<b7_0/><a1_0/>. During this trial run, Compass will offer positioning accuracy to within <b8_0>25<b8_0/> meters, but the precision will improve <a2_0>as more satellites are launched<a2_0/>. Upon the system's official launch, it pledged to offer general users positioning information <a3_0>accurate to the nearest <b9_0>10 m<b9_0/><a3_0/>, measure speeds <a4_0>within 0.2 m per second<a4_0/>, and provide signals for clock synchronisation accurate to 0.02 microseconds.
